decision_title: Defer IND submission until tox signal is resolved

target_product_profile.development_stage_relevance: IND-enabling package decision; context for deferral and re-entry criteria.

decision_question: Do we proceed with IND submission given an unexpected safety signal in the GLP dog tox study synopsis?

options_considered.description: Proceed as planned; submit IND with current dataset and address questions post-submission.
cons: Higher chance of FDA questions/clinical hold
Downstream rework likely under time pressure
options_considered.estimated_impact: Schedule benefit now; regulatory risk increased (potential hold / major information request).

options_considered.description: Defer submission; adjudicate signal and seek focused FDA feedback (pre-IND) before finalizing.
pros: Improves safety narrative and audit posture
Reduces downstream rework and hold risk
options_considered.estimated_impact: Short-term delay; improves probability of clean acceptance and reduces late-cycle churn.

conditions.condition: Complete tox adjudication memo (mechanism, human relevance, mitigation) and store in controlled location.
Submit focused pre-IND briefing package on tox signal; capture feedback and update IND nonclinical + protocol sections.
conditions.evidence_to_close: Pre-IND minutes + updated risk mitigation plan (controlled)

decision_outcome.rationale_summary: Evidence is not yet decision-ready: the safety signal is not reconciled and could trigger avoidable agency action. Deferral preserves patient safety posture and improves first-pass acceptance.

evidence_items.title: GLP Dog Tox Study (audited draft synopsis)
evidence_items.quality_notes: Audited draft available; final signed report pending. Synopsis vs appendix reconciliation pending.

evidence_items.title: Safety signal triage notes
evidence_items.quality_notes: Working notes; must be reconciled into adjudication memo.

gaps.gap: Final signed GLP tox report not available; human relevance not yet justified.
gaps.impact: Blocks confident safety narrative; may trigger agency questions/hold.
gaps.mitigation_plan: Complete tox adjudication memo; reconcile synopsis vs appendix; update nonclinical summaries + protocol safeguards.

gaps.gap: FDA feedback on mitigation approach not yet obtained.
gaps.impact: Submission risk; could require additional studies or protocol changes.
gaps.mitigation_plan: Seek focused pre-IND interaction; document outcomes; update IND narrative and monitoring plan accordingly.

assumptions.assumption: Signal is monitorable/mitigable once mechanism clarified.
assumptions.risk_if_wrong: Could still warrant clinical hold or require additional nonclinical work.
assumptions.how_to_verify: Mechanism review + FDA feedback; incorporate into monitoring/mitigation section of protocol and IB.

key_risks.risk: Clinical hold or major information request due to incomplete safety narrative
key_risks.mitigation: Defer; adjudicate tox signal; align with FDA before submission.

risk_assessment.residual_risk_statement: Residual risk remains until adjudication and FDA feedback are incorporated; proceeding now is not justified.

approvals.comments: Deferral is appropriate given unresolved safety signal; ensure controlled documentation of adjudication + FDA feedback.
Approve deferral; re-baseline timeline after pre-IND feedback and final tox report.

final_signoff.notes: Defer_with_required_evidence recorded; conditions and actions must close before resubmitting for gate approval.

controls.safety_notes: No AI assistance used in this decision.

actions.description: Draft tox adjudication memo and circulate for QC
actions.success_criteria: Memo signed and stored; discrepancies resolved.

actions.description: Draft pre-IND questions + briefing outline; schedule internal dry run
actions.success_criteria: Briefing package ready; questions approved by core team.

dependencies: Final signed GLP tox report delivery from vendor (needed by 2026-01-10; currently at risk)

change_log.summary: Created defer_with_required_evidence decision due to unexpected tox signal; linked to CR-IND-001.
